description.narrative: To support Institute for Motivating Self-Employment to work with flood affected communities in Kopai-Kuia River, Birbhum District in West Bengal. For the past decade the local communities have faced devastating floods as a result of poor river management decisions and effects of a climate change. The organization will organise a Fact Finding Mission (FFM) in a form of a three day boat trip on the Kopai-Kuia River from Laghata to Tarapur Bridge in the district of Murshidabad. During the journey, the conditions of the river would be assessed and 76 affected villages with a total population of 64,221 persons would be visited. The activists would organise River Committees, comprising of local villagers who will meet regularly to discuss the situations in their districts and strategize on the future actions. As a next step a People's Tribunal will be created, consisting of the river committees' representatives, the Irrigation Department representatives, the planning boards and environmental experts. The goal of the People's Tribunal is to develop a comprehensive river action plan, which will integrate the villagers' requirements and professional environmental advice and will provide a solid platform to initiate the dialogue and negotiate with public authorities
